title: Sincere, and big congratulations and thank you for the Mind of the Virtuoso
body:
As a designer and former musician for a long time, I'm absolutely astonished by the beaty of Mind of the Virtuoso. 

It might sound like an exageration, but I'm just blown away by the beauty of it, the pacing and build up with the music is fantastic, I was scared at first that like in the champion teaser videos, they would all feel a little bit independent of each other, but I feel it's just a big coreography of visual and sounds.

Conceptually  wise, I feel the whole trying to find out who this individual is for the last fer weeks was paid off incredibly, without even saying a word about it, and that speaks a lot about how the developers conceptualize these teasers.

I wished that it became public who the team who put together these teasers are, name wise, to really keep an eye on them, we already know  that Bastien Lecouffe Deharme was the creator behind the Sona teaser, so yeah, all in all, fantastic work from the Art department, I wouldn't normally make a post about it, but, I had to this time.

replies.body:
Thanks for your kind words, MeDicenWera! 

This was a really fun project and we're thrilled that our players are responding with such enthusiasm!

Thanks MeDicenWera!

The teams who put these pieces together work really hard to deliver something artistically, narratively, and sonically compelling. We always have a healthy respect for the ability of the community to share knowledge around the teasers, but we're really taken aback by the passion for this one.

I can only speak for Ed The Conqueror and myself when I say that often it feels like we're hermits in our little sound caves. Doing what we love for a game we love. So when we get a rare moment to step out into the daylight and a message like this is waiting for us, *man* that makes us smile.

No thank yous accepted, I'm only trying to be the voice of the (I'm sure) multiple gamers and art enthuasiasts that watched this trailer and got blown away by it.

Against my own social media honor rules, I began to share it across FB and twitter between some friends and on my college faculty's facebook page and it got a great response, and acclaim from people who couldn't believe that what was being shown to them was a tiny piece of a teaser of an online videogame. It shows that content in it's whole it's as powerful or more even than it's intended purpose.

Congratulation on the great work, honestly, fantastic way to start 2016!

It was a very excellent teaser. Little things like this give a bit of insight into each champion, even albiet unreleased ones. Some of these things really are great, like "a good death" for kindred. I can just keep rewatching/rereading and be captivated over and over.
Absolutely, I rewatched it troughout the whole day yesterday
This is the best champion trailer I've ever watched, I kept replaying it for like 20 minutes and it still amazed me :3   Good job to whoever made it.

Why was this downvoted?
 I upvote you for the sake of JUSTICE!
